name: DlpServiceClient
title: Google
Cloud
Dlp
V2
DlpServiceClient
description: The Cloud Data Loss Prevention (DLP) API is a service that allows clients to detect the presence of Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and other privacy-sensitive data in user-supplied, unstructured data streams, like text blocks or images. The service also includes methods for sensitive data redaction and scheduling of data scans on Google Cloud Platform based data sets.

params.name: credentials
params.description: Provides the means for authenticating requests made by the client. This parameter can be many types. A Google::Auth::Credentials uses a the properties of its represented keyfile for authenticating requests made by this client. A String will be treated as the path to the keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A Hash will be treated as the contents of a keyfile to be used for the construction of credentials for this client. A GRPC::Core::Channel will be used to make calls through. A GRPC::Core::ChannelCredentials for the setting up the RPC client. The channel credentials should already be composed with a GRPC::Core::CallCredentials object. A Proc will be used as an updater_proc for the Grpc channel. The proc transforms the metadata for requests, generally, to give OAuth credentials.

params.name: scopes
params.description:
The OAuth scopes for this service. This parameter is ignored if
an updater_proc is supplied.

params.name: client_config
params.description:
A Hash for call options for each method. See
Google::Gax#construct_settings for the structure of
this data. Falls back to the default config if not specified
or the specified config is missing data points.

params.name: timeout
params.description: The default timeout, in seconds, for calls made through this client.

methods.name: inspect_content
title: Google
Cloud
Dlp
V2
DlpServiceClient#inspect_content
methods.description: Finds potentially sensitive info in content. This method has limits on input size, processing time, and output size. How-to guide for text, How-to guide for images

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent resource name, for example projects/my-project-id.

params.name: inspect_config
params.description: Configuration for the inspector. What specified here will override the template referenced by the inspect_template_name argument. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::InspectConfig can also be provided.

params.name: item
params.description: The item to inspect. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::ContentItem can also be provided.

params.name: inspect_template_name
params.description:
Optional template to use. Any configuration directly specified in
inspect_config will override those set in the template. Singular fields
that are set in this request will replace their corresponding fields in the
template. Repeated fields are appended. Singular sub-messages and groups
are recursively merged.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: redact_image
title: Google
Cloud
Dlp
V2
DlpServiceClient#redact_image
methods.description: Redacts potentially sensitive info from an image. This method has limits on input size, processing time, and output size. How-to guide

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent resource name, for example projects/my-project-id.

params.name: inspect_config
params.description: Configuration for the inspector. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::InspectConfig can also be provided.

params.name: image_redaction_configs
params.description: The configuration for specifying what content to redact from images. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::RedactImageRequest::ImageRedactionConfig can also be provided.

params.name: byte_item
params.description: The content must be PNG, JPEG, SVG or BMP. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::ByteContentItem can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: deidentify_content
title: Google
Cloud
Dlp
V2
DlpServiceClient#deidentify_content
methods.description: De-identifies potentially sensitive info from a ContentItem. This method has limits on input size and output size. How-to guide

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent resource name, for example projects/my-project-id.

params.name: deidentify_config
params.description: Configuration for the de-identification of the content item. Items specified here will override the template referenced by the deidentify_template_name argument. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::DeidentifyConfig can also be provided.

params.name: inspect_config
params.description: Configuration for the inspector. Items specified here will override the template referenced by the inspect_template_name argument. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::InspectConfig can also be provided.

params.name: item
params.description: The item to de-identify. Will be treated as text. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::ContentItem can also be provided.

params.name: inspect_template_name
params.description:
Optional template to use. Any configuration directly specified in
inspect_config will override those set in the template. Singular fields
that are set in this request will replace their corresponding fields in the
template. Repeated fields are appended. Singular sub-messages and groups
are recursively merged.

params.name: deidentify_template_name
params.description:
Optional template to use. Any configuration directly specified in
deidentify_config will override those set in the template. Singular fields
that are set in this request will replace their corresponding fields in the
template. Repeated fields are appended. Singular sub-messages and groups
are recursively merged.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: reidentify_content
title: Google
Cloud
Dlp
V2
DlpServiceClient#reidentify_content
methods.description: Re-identifies content that has been de-identified.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent resource name.

params.name: reidentify_config
params.description:
Configuration for the re-identification of the content item. This field shares the same proto message type that is used for de-identification, however its usage here is for the reversal of the previous de-identification. Re-identification is performed by examining the transformations used to de-identify the items and executing the reverse. This requires that only reversible transformations be provided here. The reversible transformations are:

  • +CryptoReplaceFfxFpeConfig+ A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::DeidentifyConfig can also be provided.

params.name: inspect_config
params.description: Configuration for the inspector. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::InspectConfig can also be provided.

params.name: item
params.description: The item to re-identify. Will be treated as text. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::ContentItem can also be provided.

params.name: inspect_template_name
params.description:
Optional template to use. Any configuration directly specified in
+inspect_config+ will override those set in the template. Singular fields
that are set in this request will replace their corresponding fields in the
template. Repeated fields are appended. Singular sub-messages and groups
are recursively merged.

params.name: reidentify_template_name
params.description:
Optional template to use. References an instance of +DeidentifyTemplate+.
Any configuration directly specified in +reidentify_config+ or
+inspect_config+ will override those set in the template. Singular fields
that are set in this request will replace their corresponding fields in the
template. Repeated fields are appended. Singular sub-messages and groups
are recursively merged.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: list_info_types
title: Google
Cloud
Dlp
V2
DlpServiceClient#list_info_types
methods.description: Returns a list of the sensitive information types that the DLP API supports. For more information, see Listing supported predefined infoTypes.

params.name: language_code
params.description:
Optional BCP-47 language code for localized infoType friendly
names. If omitted, or if localized strings are not available,
en-US strings will be returned.

params.name: filter
params.description:
Optional filter to only return infoTypes supported by certain parts of the
API. Defaults to supported_by=INSPECT.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

methods.name: create_inspect_template
title: Google
Cloud
Dlp
V2
DlpServiceClient#create_inspect_template
methods.description: Creates an inspect template for re-using frequently used configuration for inspecting content, images, and storage.

params.name: parent
params.description:
The parent resource name, for example projects/my-project-id or
organizations/my-org-id.

params.name: inspect_template
params.description: The InspectTemplate to create. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::InspectTemplate can also be provided.

params.name: template_id
params.description:
The template id can contain uppercase and lowercase letters,
numbers, and hyphens; that is, it must match the regular
expression: +[a-zA-Z\d-]++. The maximum length is 100
characters. Can be empty to allow the system to generate one.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

Dlp
V2
DlpServiceClient#update_inspect_template

params.name: name
params.description:
Resource name of organization and inspectTemplate to be updated, for
example +organizations/433245324/inspectTemplates/432452342+ or
projects/project-id/inspectTemplates/432452342.

params.name: inspect_template
params.description: New InspectTemplate value. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::InspectTemplate can also be provided.

params.name: update_mask
params.description: Mask to control which fields get updated. A hash of the same form as Google::Protobuf::FieldMask can also be provided.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

Dlp

DlpServiceClient#list_inspect_templates

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/dlp/v2"

dlp_service_client = Google::Cloud::Dlp::V2.new
formatted_parent = Google::Cloud::Dlp::V2::DlpServiceClient.organization_path("[ORGANIZATION]")

# Iterate over all results.
dlp_service_client.list_inspect_templates(formatted_parent).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
dlp_service_client.list_inspect_templates(formatted_parent).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

methods.name: list_dlp_jobs
title: Google
Cloud
Dlp
V2
DlpServiceClient#list_dlp_jobs
methods.description: Lists DlpJobs that match the specified filter in the request.

examples.code:
require "google/cloud/dlp/v2"

dlp_service_client = Google::Cloud::Dlp::V2.new
formatted_parent = Google::Cloud::Dlp::V2::DlpServiceClient.project_path("[PROJECT]")

# Iterate over all results.
dlp_service_client.list_dlp_jobs(formatted_parent).each do |element|
  # Process element.
end

# Or iterate over results one page at a time.
dlp_service_client.list_dlp_jobs(formatted_parent).each_page do |page|
  # Process each page at a time.
  page.each do |element|
    # Process element.
  end
end

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent resource name, for example projects/my-project-id.

params.name: filter
params.description:
Optional. Allows filtering.

Supported syntax:

  • Filter expressions are made up of one or more restrictions.
  • Restrictions can be combined by +AND+ or +OR+ logical operators. A sequence of restrictions implicitly uses +AND+.
  • A restriction has the form of + +.
  • Supported fields/values for inspect jobs:
    • +state+ - PENDING RUNNING CANCELED FINISHED FAILED
      • +inspected_storage+ - DATASTORE CLOUD_STORAGE BIGQUERY
      • +trigger_name+ - The resource name of the trigger that created job.
    • Supported fields for risk analysis jobs:
      • +state+ - RUNNING CANCELED FINISHED FAILED
    • The operator must be +=+ or +!=+.

    Examples:

  • inspected_storage = cloud_storage AND state = done
  • inspected_storage = cloud_storage OR inspected_storage = bigquery
  • inspected_storage = cloud_storage AND (state = done OR state = canceled)

The length of this field should be no more than 500 characters.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: type
params.description: The type of job. Defaults to +DlpJobType.INSPECT+

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::DlpJob instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent resource name, for example projects/my-project-id.

params.name: page_size
params.description:
The maximum number of resources contained in the underlying API
response. If page streaming is performed per-resource, this
parameter does not affect the return value. If page streaming is
performed per-page, this determines the maximum number of
resources in a page.

params.name: order_by
params.description:
Optional comma separated list of triggeredJob fields to order by, followed by ‘asc/desc’ postfix, i.e. +”create_time asc,name desc,schedule_mode asc”+. This list is case-insensitive.

Example: +”name asc,schedule_mode desc, status desc”+

Supported filters keys and values are:

  • +create_time+: corresponds to time the triggeredJob was created.
  • +update_time+: corresponds to time the triggeredJob was last updated.
  • +name+: corresponds to JobTrigger’s display name.
  • +status+: corresponds to the triggeredJob status.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.

returns.description:
An enumerable of Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::JobTrigger instances.
See Google::Gax::PagedEnumerable documentation for other
operations such as per-page iteration or access to the response
object.

V2
DlpServiceClient#create_job_trigger
methods.description: Creates a job trigger to run DLP actions such as scanning storage for sensitive information on a set schedule.

params.name: parent
params.description: The parent resource name, for example projects/my-project-id.

params.name: job_trigger
params.description: The JobTrigger to create. A hash of the same form as Google::Privacy::Dlp::V2::JobTrigger can also be provided.

params.name: trigger_id
params.description:
The trigger id can contain uppercase and lowercase letters,
numbers, and hyphens; that is, it must match the regular
expression: +[a-zA-Z\d-]++. The maximum length is 100
characters. Can be empty to allow the system to generate one.

params.name: options
params.description:
Overrides the default settings for this call, e.g, timeout,
retries, etc.
